pros:
Work/life balance is great at LCCC. In the event extra time off is required for illness, family needs, personal wellness, there are no questions asked. As long as you're keeping up with your student's needs and maintaining your workflow, management is supportive. 
The place is friendly for the most part. The campus is lovely. Great faculty and decent course selection. It's a terrific community college and really enriches the area.
 There is a LOT to be proud of here.
cons:
There is little employee training, but it was fairly easy to catch on to my duties. 
I worked remotely and was OFTEN left out of the loop, not included in department activities, and rarely updated to changes. There is an attitude of "whatever" from some employees, which is aggravating for someone who works well with defined answers. 
The pay for my position was well below fair market wage, and it became impossible to maintain the job requirements while surviving on such a small paycheck.

review_title: L&C has truly changed my life by giving me the opportunity to help others as they begin their educational journeys.
job_title: Media Specialist, Adjunct Faculty Member in Godfrey, IL
pros:
Being a part of the L&C family has made me happier. I am surrounded by caring, professional individuals who support me in my endeavors. My supervisor cares about me as a person and not just as an employee. The culture here on campus is one of acceptance and support. I am given ample vacation time and wonderful health care benefits. As an L&C team member, I am working on a variety of projects that positively impact my community and even the world.

The campus is also a beautiful place to work. I wouldn't want to be employed anywhere else.
cons: Because L&C employs so many people, it is hard to really know everyone. We do gather for special celebrations and events, but I would like to experience more campus-wide team building exercises.

pros: Great campus with many old buildings. Commuter easy parking. Some great staff and caring instructors give back at least as much as you put in!
cons: ..many old buildings cram in new tech and poor maintenance. Most seem there for the students but high turnover and poor training opertunities for staff. Who you know.

review_title: Great community college,  but low pay
job_title: Community Education Center Coordinator in Godfrey, IL
pros: The LCCC campus is lovely and inspired.  They boast some very esteemed faculty members.  Opportunities for continued education.
cons: I worked remotely, at a small community campus offsite. Communication from middle management was poor, changes were often not shared. It felt very "sink or swim". Also, remote employees are NOT included in campus culture, we are not invited to the office get togethers, etc.  It was a lonely job.  Pay is below fair market in the region. It's considered to be a partner college to SIUE, yet advisors are paid FAR below their counterparts.

review_title: Lewis and Clark Community College is a wonderful place to teach. Very innovative and top notch facilities!
pros: Great faculty, beautiful facilities and amazing technology! President and board are forward thinking and have the students and faculty's best interests.
cons: I cannot think of any cons as this institution and it's leaders are innovative and strive to keep things afloat with the volatile economic climate in Illinois.
